data.title: Spicy Food and Dental Implants: Low Prices Lure Hong Kongers to China
data.excerpt: Hong Kong residents are finding in Shenzhen, the mainland city next door, lower prices, better service and tasty cuisine.

data.title: Tiki Hangover: Unearthing the False Idols of America’s South Seas Fantasy
data.excerpt: The Tiki lifestyle conjures the sound of distant waves and lilting ukuleles, but Tiki culture actually owes its existence to an intersection of complex forces.

data.title: Today’s Satellite Boom Was Foretold in Busts of Yesteryear
data.excerpt: Musk and Bezos are betting that their space ventures won’t replay Motorola’s Iridium flop three decades ago.

data.title: Where Everyone’s an Influencer and Everything’s for Sale

data.title: 7 Unhelpful Habits Everyone Should Quit

data.title: Why Data Breaches Spiked in 2023

data.title: 20 Cardio Exercises That Deliver Huge Results

data.title: AUDIO: Listen to a Rare 1964 Record by Iconic Indian Classical Music Icons — the Dagar Brothers
data.excerpt: In the intricate tapestry of North Indian classical music, the Dagar Brothers, Moinuddin and Aminuddin, stand as luminaries, their voices echoing through time as torchbearers of the ancient dhrupad tradition.

data.title: How Slavery Became America’s First Big Business

data.title: 50 of the world's best breads
data.excerpt: What is bread? You likely don’t have to think for long, and whether you’re hungry for a slice of sourdough or craving some tortillas, what you imagine says a lot about where you’re from.

data.excerpt: Already explored Rome, Berlin, and Barcelona?

data.title: The fight with flat-pack furniture

data.title: Why Assam’s Muslims see discrimination in state’s flagship scheme for the rural landless
data.excerpt: The Assam chief minister recently declared that neither Bengali-origin nor ethnic Assamese Muslims qualify for the scheme. Legislators and experts contest this.

data.title: Working from home can bring big health benefits, study finds
data.excerpt: Working from home allows people to eat more healthily, feel less stressed and have lower blood pressure, according to a large-scale review of academic literature on post-pandemic workplaces.

data.title: That Urge to Squeeze Cute Things Has a Name, It's Called Cute Aggression
data.excerpt: Wanting to squeeze or bite an animal’s ears or feet is called cute aggression and scientists are trying to understand why we do it.

data.title: The Big Idea: This Simple Behavioural Trick Can Help You Get More Out of Life
data.excerpt: Habituation is a key component of human nature, and knowing how to manipulate it can make the things you enjoy even better.

data.title: The Skilled Workers Training AI to Take Their Jobs
data.excerpt: A new workforce of language experts, creative writers, and nuclear physicists are turning to data labor—and potentially making their future jobs obsolete in the process.

data.title: Will India's megaproject sink Great Nicobar island?
data.excerpt: India is determined to build its own "Hong Kong" on the pristine Great Nicobar island. Activists warn the impact could go beyond wrecking the environment — it could spell extinction for indigenous islanders.

data.title: What If Each Indian Could Sponsor Nutrition For 1 Malnourished Child? IAS Officer Makes it Possible
data.excerpt: District Collector Avi Prasad started a special programme in Katni district, Madhya Pradesh, asking people to adopt malnourished kids and give them nutritional support — this helped reduce malnutrition by 30 percent.

data.title: How to Make Wildly Original—And Successful—Blockbusters in Hollywood

data.title: Why We Fear Uncertainty — and Why We Shouldn’t
data.excerpt: Expert knowledge is useful for problem-solving. So is adapting to new challenges.

data.title: Why can’t I just love Bangalore?
data.excerpt: I visualise a day when I will run into the arms of Bangalore and collapse in a breathless embrace. But that day never comes.
